instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message: I changed the Flat and IO POWER several times, but it didn't work, can you tell me what it could be ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R1781</RESISTOR>/981.
Post AUD_IP_PERIPHERAL_DET w/ and w/ headpnoes connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
The <RESISTOR>R1981</RESISTOR> region had oxidation, I replaced the components, but no result.
AUD_IP_PERIPHERAL_DET 21mV without the headphone
AUD_IP_PERIPHERAL_DET 3.3V with the headphone connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
Detection pin works.
Volume control shows headphones always?
No speakers available, when heaphones removed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 84268, member: 682"]
No speakers available, when heaphones removed?
[/QUOTE]
Exactly.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 84268, member: 682"]
Volume control shows headphones always?
[/QUOTE]

Yes, it shows the volume signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
Opem System Preferences and go to Sound tab.
Connect/disconnect headphones and tell us if both speakers and headphones appear there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
The speakers don't appear at all.
Only the headset appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message: When you remove the headphones, any other output option remains on Sound tab?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> makes the headset active.
threads.message:
And which is that other option???
I'm not really sure we correctly understand here :(...
